All Packages  Class Hierarchy  This Package  Previous  Next  Index

Class jogl.JoglCanvas 

java.lang.Object
   |
   +----java.awt.Component
           |
           +----java.awt.Canvas
                   |
                   +----jogl.JoglCanvas
public class JoglCanvas
extends Canvas
implements ComponentListener
Define a class JoglCanvas which depends on native methods to implement 3D graphics through OpenGL. We implement ComponentListener and listen to ourselves because of how we had to do things on SGI's. On SGI's we aren't actually rendering in to the java.awt.Canvas object. We have to create another window and make it a child of the canvas because in order to use SGI's hardware acceleration via X we need to create the window in a very specific manner.

renderContext
window data for the widget

JoglCanvas()
JoglCanvas(JoglRenderer)
constructor for the JoglCanvas object given the name of the widget.

renderContext 
 protected int renderContext
window data for the widget

JoglCanvas 
 public JoglCanvas(JoglRenderer rend) throws JoglNativeException
constructor for the JoglCanvas object given the name of the widget. opens the JoglCanvas window and sets up the graphics context

JoglCanvas 
 public JoglCanvas() throws JoglNativeException

paint 
 public void paint(Graphics g)
This method does initialization. It was my impression that this stuff should go in AddNotify but that didn't seem to work. This stuff is only executed once.

polygonMode 
 public native void polygonMode(int face,
                                int mode)
FRONT, BACK, FRONT_AND_BACK are accepted values for face POINT, LINE, FILL are accepted values for mode

pushAttrib 
 public native void pushAttrib(int mask)
ACCUM_BUFFER_BIT, COLOR_BUFFER_BIT, CURRENT_BIT, DEPTH_BUFFER_BIT, ENABLE_BIT, EVAL_BIT, FOG_BIT, HINT_BIT, LIGHTING_BIT, LINE_BIT, LIST_BIT, PIXEL_MODE_BIT, POINT_BIT, POLYGON_BIT, POLYGON_STIPPLE_BIT, SCISSOR_BIT, STENCIL_BUFFER_BIT, TEXTURE_BIT, TRANSFORM_BIT, VIEWPORT_BIT are accepted values for mask

 public native void readBuffer(int mode)

stencilOp 
 public native void stencilOp(int fail,
                              int zfail,
                              int zpass)
KEEP, ZERO, REPLACE, INCR, DECR, INVERT are accepted values for fail, zfail and zpass
